body:
Hi @atibon 

This is not a heron issue.  

It's more likely [MAT's/Eclipse MAT's bug](https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=471757).
Please check more detail log following of the `NullPointerException`.
Apparently Bazel has Windows support according to: https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/1497. I guess there is nothing stopping you from doing a release?

Finally, I got it to run!  It was indeed the `127.0.0.1:2181` culprit printed in `__main__.log`!

I wasn't able to backtrace where this setting came from but poking around I finally found the file `/etc/default/aurora-scheduler` on `nimbus` and changed the occurrences of 127.0.0.1 in the appropriate places such that:

```
$ grep "2181" /etc/default/aurora-scheduler
ZK_ENDPOINTS="10.9.9.10:2181"
THERMOS_EXECUTOR_FLAGS="--announcer-ensemble 10.9.9.10:2181"
```

Now I will roll back to the Heron 0.14.0 release and see if it works as well.  Closing this issue as it is solved.
@lilalinda - thanks for figuring out the issue. I was wondering if you could provide feedback on how to improve this. We released 0.14.1 which is stable as well.
@ajorgensen - looks like the unit tests failed.
@sirinath - it looks like the bazel support is experimental. However, you are welcome to try it out and provide a patch.

@alanngai 

Our goal after merging this PR is to enable Python style checker. Checkout #587 and you can see currently [we disable Python style checker in CI](https://github.com/twitter/heron/pull/587/files#diff-4c3a4e61471476647ad1c0987a744414R39).

You can refer to #587 and run 

`bazel build --config=darwin --experimental_action_listener=tools/python:compile_python heron/cli/src/python/...`

We want this command have exit status 0.

@alanngai - just to clarify what @objmagic and @cckellogg pointed out
- Merge with the current master
- There is an exception that occurs in tracker which @cckellogg pointed out to reverting the changes in a single file. Let us revert this first or fix the error occurring in this file.
- @objmagic mentioned that there are still python style checker errors occurring in your code. Could you run the style checker again and please fix those?
- Once these are done, we will merge the code and then address the changes to enable python checker by default.
@benley - we are in the process of upgrading the pex. Please check out the pull request #1052
I'll try to keep my fork in sync with the update!  Haven't had time to do much work on this in the last week but I'll get back to it soon.
@kramasamy yeah it looks like they updated their dependency on http_core, I updated the PR with that change, tests should pass now.

@kramasamy 
1. I'll take a look at fixing or reverting `heron.py` later today 
2. wrt python checkstyle errors, there are 2 classes of errors
   - explicitly ignored checkstyle errors
   - errors that I don't have enough context to fix (labelled with FIXME), one of which I've filed an issue for (#855)

in other words, i can tackle (1) but not (2)
Thx! Please sign the [CLA](https://engineering.twitter.com/opensource/cla) first.
@objmagic Done. Thanks!

> @windie - does this cover all the java tests?

No. I only updated `heron/common`, `heron/instance`, `heron/metricsmgr` and `heron/packing`. Should I update this PR for other modules or send a separate one after this one gets merged?
I see there are some checkstyle errors which I don't get when building locally and running the tests. Is there any way to run chcekstyle alone and figure out what is wrong?

@avflor 
Try with: bazel build --config=darwin --experimental_action_listener=tools/java:compile_java heron/...
@maosongfu Thanks! I tried this command and it still works locally. I'm working on Ubuntu but we also tried on a mac and we don't get any checkstyle errors there as well.

I checked out your branch and ran

`bazel build --config=darwin --experimental_action_listener=tools/java:compile_java heron/packing/...`

I can see 9 style errors.
@avflor Maybe you need "bazel clean" first? @billonahill may have better ideas on this.

Yes. I can see the errors after "bazel clean".

On Mon, Jul 11, 2016 at 1:36 PM, Maosong Fu notifications@github.com
wrote:

> @avflor https://github.com/avflor Maybe you need "bazel clean" first?
> @billonahill https://github.com/billonahill may have better ideas on
> this.
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/twitter/heron/pull/1059#issuecomment-231856675, or mute
> the thread
> https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe/AJkbjKcI9T_ITc4xiFi585q0ZdwVoBRNks5qUqlagaJpZM4JJrSl
> .
@windie - please do update the other java code as well just to ensure consistency
@objmagic - can you cut and paste the checkstyle errors for @avflor?
@ashvina are you the same guy as @avflor? and who is @avrilia? what is going on here?

@avflor - one broader comment is to write a documentation about this packing algorithm.
- What does the algorithm do?
- When is it useful and its pros and cons?
- How to enable it?

@kramasamy I fixed the checkstyle errors. After bazel clean I was able to see them and I checked in the new code. I will write some extra documentation. I have some comments about the algo in the code but I can expand.

@objmagic Thanks for noticing that. There has been some weird configuration issue and apparently GitHub linked my email with an old GitHub account (avrilia). I will fix this and from now on only avflor will be used.
@avflor please fix two Java Docs error [here](https://travis-ci.org/twitter/heron/builds/144013684#L1665). You should use `<` and `>`.
@zhangzhonglai - can you update the PR since there are some conflicts? Then I can merge it.
@kramasamy Done.
@caofangkun I've fixed it.

You may try with heron-tracker: http://twitter.github.io/heron/docs/operators/heron-tracker/
And here is the RESTful API: http://twitter.github.io/heron/docs/operators/heron-tracker-api/

But heron-tracker provides only filtered metrics: https://github.com/twitter/heron/blob/master/heron/config/src/yaml/conf/examples/metrics_sinks.yaml#L44

If you want to get more metrics, one simple way is to look at metrics.json.\* under working directory.
@atibon what do you mean by "not right"? Could you please tell us which particular part of metrics is incorrect in the table above?
@alanngai - thanks let us do 1) first and merge it. I will request @objmagic to take care of 2).
@ajorgensen - can you review this PR since you are the closest to write a new packing algorithm?

@kramasamy @alanngai @cckellogg @nlu90 

As for 1), we are actually talking about two errors:
1. https://github.com/twitter/heron/pull/849#issuecomment-230960262, which is fixed by @nlu90 
2. https://github.com/twitter/heron/pull/849#issuecomment-230960639, which we had no idea in this morning. 

However, I just realized I have seen the same error message before. I checked with @nlu90 this afternoon and we believe that this error happens because metrics info is refreshed every one minute, and if you fire up `heron-tracker` and `heron-ui` immediately after you submit the topology, this exception will show up. **If you refresh the UI after one minute you open the `heron-ui/heron-tracker`, you will not see any error message.**

Another reason that makes me more confident in my conclusion is that @alanngai 's change on `heron.py` is purely syntax level change and involves no change on the semantic of the program. If we really want to consider the above scenario in the above paragraph an issue, we can merge this issue first, and I can submit a new PR to make sure no exception will be thrown even if there is no metrics information.
@kramasamy and yes, I can look into 2) after we merge this.
@objmagic - regarding the exception trace for 2) - can you fix in a separate PR and send a pull request?

@objmagic For example, Emit Count for 10 mins  is 0. 
And sometimes all of the metrics value is 0.
@maosongfu Thx. I will try.
interesting. cc/ @cckellogg . Could you please have a look at this problem?
@kramasamy - Updated
@objmagic Maybe network problem. BTW, Must I collect all of metrics.json.\* under hundreds of sandbox directories if I wanner get the correct data?

@atibon I don't think you need to, and I understand it is not realistic for you to collect all the information under hundreds of sandbox dirs. If there is really something wrong with the metrics you see on Heron UI, I'd say it's our mistake to have `heron-ui` display incorrect information. That being said, it is not necessary for you to dig into `metrics.json.*`, if you think our `heron-ui` fails to present you correct information.

Let's keep this issue open to keep track of what is going on with the Heron UI for you :)
@objmagic - if that is the case, this PR is ready to be merged.
@objmagic and @nlu90 - can this PR be merged if internal CIs work?
@kramasamy yes
One more think to check is to make sure the docker builds work. Once that's verified I think it's fine to merge.
Should we change it into protected so later we can use it in Unit test?
Looks good to me!
I prefer making methods as closed-scoped as possible and opening scope when needed. So once we write a test we can change it to protected and annotate it `@VisibleForTesting`.
LGTM
@maosongfu - why the claim that it is not scalable? I understand the fault tolerance aspect of it but not sure the scalability part of it.

@kramasamy 
Scalability can be considered from a lot of point of views. For instance, this scheduler would not cache offer, which means it may take a long time to schedule a big topology, since the tasks need to be scheduled one by one with new incoming offers.
@windie - provided more feedback.
@billonahill - Will this functionality good for heron explorer?

@maosongfu - however when the job is scheduled, it knows upfront the number of containers and the resources it requires. As Mesos keeps giving those offers, we could grab those resources and schedule containers.

@kramasamy 
Consider Mesos keeps giving offers slowly, it will take a long time to receive enough offers to fully schedule a big topology. Also, it is just one case. There are still a lot of potential improvement for scalability.

I thought about that, but heron explorer shows a cleansed view of topology state for end users. This shows a raw dump of what proto objects exist in the state store, so it's more useful for developers inspecting state.

I have some checkstyle errors to address too.

Could you also release installers for CentOS6? Since most of our servers are running on CentOS 6.5.
Thank you!

@kramasamy @caofangkun 

I tested out and this looks fine. Please remove the duplicate shebang and I will merge this.

@alanngai @kramasamy 

I think we can go ahead and merge this PR now.

I will keep track of related issues after merging this PR. Namely:
1. fix https://github.com/twitter/heron/pull/849#issuecomment-231932982
2. fix https://github.com/twitter/heron/pull/849#issuecomment-231834711 ("errors that I don't have enough context to fix (labelled with FIXME)")
3. #578 #579 #580 #581 #582 #583 #584
👍  for internal jenkins CI
@benley do you want to have a look at this PR?
Should we close since @taishi8117 is working on similar task, which does not use the code in this PR?
I don't know if we need to move the packing plan classes into specific schedulers, but we should have a concept of which packing plans are and are not supported (or ideal) for a given scheduler.

I think you might be missing some updates to pex/bin/pex.py; here's what that diff looks like from my repo: https://github.com/benley/bazel_rules_pex/pull/6/files#diff-da6b827279fc47e8b1603fe3af0f4a0e

The changes are pretty minor, so maybe you deliberately didn't include them?
Aside from that, 👍

I did not mean to move packing plan classes to schedulers. Sorry for the confusion. I am suggesting that scheduler specific computation be outside packing algorithm. For e.g. method `RoundRobinPacking.getLargestContainerRam` should be in moved to `AuroraScheduler` and should be used in `createAuroraProperties`. 

I can submit a patch to clarify in detail.
@benley I applied your patch: https://github.com/twitter/heron/pull/1052/commits/37f9d7498c535dc13c0fec5e8b3c19c494ea1ce6 and I can build fine.
Travis CI, internal CI, Docker build all passed, again.
change committed this morning is lost when rebasing..
@billonahill I created a patch for this https://github.com/ashvina/heron/commit/59234cf9acc3acfc5f43d2d3e4d3d742457a0be7

Please don't merge this PR until we verified this change doesn't break Twitter's internal building environment for Heron.

Also, we just upgraded to bazel 0.2.3, it should be a stable building tool for some time.
looks good to me. 👍
@nlu90 - this PR works even with bazel 0.2.3 in my mac.
Sounds good to me. Let us wait until @ashvina takes a look at it.

@windie - overall comment is to keep the assignments of temporary variables for deps and use those variables wherever needed. Otherwise, the dependency lists are too long and hard to read. Once you fix these, we could merge the PR.
@daxwang - should we close this, if this is not an issue?
This is completed.

Yes, this one works with both Bazel 0.2.3 and 0.3.0.

I was working on #524 and found homebrew had upgraded to Bazel 0.3.0. So I submitted this PR to unblock #524.
@windie - now you could work on #524

@kramasamy @nlu90 
Did we verify this change not to break Twitter's internal building environment for Heron?
